page.title: 09Housing
page.content: Most of the housing in Halifax is old terraces,located close to the town centre,stretching towards the west. There are large council estates in Mixenden and Illingworth,to the north of the town,and modern private housing around the old terraces in the west, around Pellon. There are 3 types of housing in Southowram;the council housing built after the war,the semi- detached houses built between the wars and the old village housing,built in the 18th century.Some cottages and farms date back to the 17th century and the school was built in 1876. Under Southowram,there are a lot of disused mine shafts which were dug in the 18th century to get coal.Subsidence in the area is a large problem.Nobody knows exactly where the shafts are or how many there are.
